eu.smartdatalake.simsearch.manager.ingested.categorical

Class TokenSetCollectionReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.smartdatalake.simsearch.manager.ingested.categorical.TokenSetCollectionReader

  • public class TokenSetCollectionReader
extends Object
    Accepts sets or keywords (or strings) and converts them to sets of tokens. After ingestion, these sets of tokens can be indexed and used in categorical (set-based) or textual (string) similarity search.

    • Method Detail

      • importFromCsvFile

        public TokenSetCollection importFromCsvFile(String file,
                                            int colSetId,
                                            int colSetTokens,
                                            String colDelimiter,
                                            String tokDelimiter,
                                            int maxLines,
                                            boolean header,
                                            int qgram,
                                            Logger log)
        Consumes a CSV file and creates a collection of the sets of tokens to be used in similarity search.
        Parameters:
        file - Path to the input CSV file or its URL at a remote server containing the attribute data.
        colSetId - Ordinal number of the attribute holding the entity identifiers.
        colSetTokens - Ordinal number of the attribute containing the sets of tokens (e.g., keywords).
        colDelimiter - Delimiter character between columns in the file.
        tokDelimiter - Delimiter character between tokens.
        maxLines - Number of the first lines to read from the file, skipping the rest; if a negative value is specified, all lines will be consumed.
        header - Boolean indicating that the first line contains the names of the attributes.
        qgram - The qgram used (if applicable for string similarity).
        log - Handle to the log file for keeping messages and statistics.
        Returns:
        A collection of the sets of tokens to be used in similarity search.

      • importFromJdbcTable

        public TokenSetCollection importFromJdbcTable(String tableName,
                                              String keyColumnName,
                                              String valColumnName,
                                              String tokDelimiter,
                                              JdbcConnector jdbcConnector,
                                              int qgram,
                                              Logger log)
        Accesses a DBMS table using a JDBC connection and creates a collection of the sets of tokens to be used in similarity search.
        Parameters:
        tableName - Name of the table that holds the attribute data.
        keyColumnName - Column name of the attribute holding the entity identifiers.
        valColumnName - Column name of the attribute containing the sets of tokens (e.g., keywords).
        tokDelimiter - Delimiter character between tokens.
        jdbcConnector - The JDBC connection that provides access to the table.
        qgram - The qgram used (if applicable for string similarity).
        log - Handle to the log file for keeping messages and statistics.
        Returns:
        A collection of the sets of tokens to be used in similarity search.

      • createQueryFromCsvFile

        public TokenSetCollection createQueryFromCsvFile(String file,
                                                 int colSetId,
                                                 int colSetTokens,
                                                 String colDelimiter,
                                                 String tokDelimiter,
                                                 int maxLines,
                                                 boolean header,
                                                 int qgram,
                                                 int queryId,
                                                 Logger log)
        Consumes a CSV file and creates a collection of the sets of tokens to be used as query in similarity search.
        Parameters:
        file - Path to the input CSV file or its URL at a remote server containing the sets of tokens specified in the query.
        colSetId - Ordinal number of the attribute holding the entity identifiers.
        colSetTokens - Ordinal number of the attribute containing the sets of tokens (e.g., keywords).
        colDelimiter - Delimiter character between columns in the file.
        tokDelimiter - Delimiter character between tokens.
        maxLines - Number of the first lines to read from the file, skipping the rest; if a negative value is specified, all lines will be consumed.
        header - Boolean indicating that the first line contains the names of the attributes.
        qgram - The qgram used (if applicable for string similarity).
        queryId - Line number in the file that contains the query specification and is being used as the query identifier.
        log - Handle to the log file for keeping messages and statistics.
        Returns:
        A collection of the sets of tokens to be used as the query specification in similarity search.

      • createFromQueryKeywords

        public TokenSetCollection createFromQueryKeywords(String keywords,
                                                  String tokDelimiter,
                                                  int qgram,
                                                  Logger log)
        Accepts a string of keywords and creates a collection of the sets of tokens to be used as query in similarity search.
        Parameters:
        keywords - A string containing the keywords to be used as tokens.
        tokDelimiter - Delimiter character between keywords.
        qgram - The qgram used (if applicable for string similarity).
        log - Handle to the log file for keeping messages and statistics.
        Returns:
        A collection of the sets of tokens to be used as the query specification in similarity search.

      • createFromQueryString

        public TokenSetCollection createFromQueryString(String value,
                                                int qgram,
                                                Logger log)
        Parameters:
        value - Accepts a query string and creates a collection of the sets of tokens to be used as query in similarity search.
        qgram - The qgram used (if applicable for string similarity).
        log - Handle to the log file for keeping messages and statistics.
        Returns:
        A collection of the sets of tokens to be used as the query specification in similarity search.

      • createFromQueryKeywords

        public TokenSetCollection createFromQueryKeywords(String[] keywords,
                                                  int qgram,
                                                  Logger log)
        Accepts an array of keywords and creates a collection of the sets of tokens to be used as query in similarity search.
        Parameters:
        keywords - An array of keywords to be used as tokens.
        qgram - The qgram used (if applicable for string similarity).
        log - Handle to the log file for keeping messages and statistics.
        Returns:
        A collection of the sets of tokens to be used as the query specification in similarity search.

      • buildInvertedIndex

        public InvertedIndex buildInvertedIndex(TokenSetCollection targetCollection,
                                        Logger log)
        Creates an inverted index against the given collection of sets of tokens. FIXME: queryCollection is NOT known when the index is built
        Parameters:
        targetCollection - A collection of sets of tokens to be indexed.
        log - Handle to the log file for keeping messages and statistics.
        Returns:
        An inverted index to facilitate similarity search operations against the sets of tokens.
